item.title: To draw map using R
item.description: Background Many articles need to use maps to display some data. Professional drawing software such as ARCGIS is more expensive and takes a long time to learn. The advantage of drawing with R is that everyone can install R and R maps have no copyright issues and are easy to use. The main R packages used are ggplot2, sf, rnaturalearth, rnaturalearthdata, etc. When you need to modify the picture, you only need to modify the code, which eliminates the cumbersome modification of the picture.
